page.title: 10CULTIVATED LAND USE S.DOWNS
page.content: Farming the downland consists of ploughing for crops, managing grass- land & animals, & forestry management. Crops grown are usually cereals, but sometimes roots. In October fields had been ploughed but not sown. Much of the land is cultivated grassland, but there is some rough grazing. Hay has been cut & rolled. Friesian cattle graze & a few horses are near Broadham House. Sheep were only seen grazing near Newhouse Farm. Forestry management consists of clearing old trees & replanting with conifers or deciduous trees. Singleton forest has large areas of replanted oaks, beech and sycamore. There are various areas of conifers with wide grassy rides between them as fire breaks, & stony tracks for timber removal. Foresters cull the deer to prevent damage to young trees.
